summaries.brief_summary: Two PRs opened for Dune package management compatibility improvements
summaries.activity_summary: Dune package management compatibility and build performance work
summaries.activity:
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened PR to add **Dune package management compatibility patch** for odoc-parser, addressing symlink limitations by copying files instead since Dune package management doesn't yet support symlinks ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/22), related to upstream work at [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392) and [ocaml/dune#9873](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/9873))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened PR to make **compiler build with Dune package management faster** by unsetting environment variable to enable build concurrency, reducing build time from 32 minutes to 14 minutes ([#25](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/25), addressing [ocaml/dune#12737](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12737) with related upstream PR [ocaml/dune#12800](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12800))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on Dune package management integration and compatibility
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Dune package management integration** work continues with focus on resolving compatibility issues including symlink handling and build concurrency problems that affect OxCaml compiler builds ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/22), [#25](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/25))
- **Build performance optimization** through configuration adjustments, achieving over 50% reduction in build time when using Dune package management by enabling proper concurrency ([#25](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/25))
summaries.contributors_summary: Sudha Parimala opened two PRs for Dune package management improvements
summaries.contributors: - [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened two PRs addressing Dune package management compatibility: added odoc-parser compatibility patch to work around symlink limitations ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/22)) and implemented build concurrency fix to reduce compiler build time from 32 to 14 minutes ([#25](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/25))

summaries.brief_summary: Major package version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 with Dune package management compatibility work and eio fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: Eio compatibility fix, sedlex 3.6 package added, ppxlib AST updates, notty-community terminal enhancements, js_of_ocaml patches
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **eio.1.3+ox compatibility** with latest oxcaml by explicitly currying function application in eio_mock to avoid "surplus arguments" error ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24), [89f9d1a](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/89f9d1a693401b3f9461983942ec32454c4d23e0))
- Added **sedlex 3.6+ox package** providing Unicode lexer generator with ppx syntax extension support ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Updated **ppxlib 0.33.0+ox** with comprehensive AST patches for oxcaml compatibility including ast_999, migration paths, and pprintast support ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Added **notty-community 0.2.4+ox** with terminal improvements including HREF support, cursor types, line-based diffing, fast TTY width, and multidomain safety ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Updated **js_of_ocaml 6.0.1+ox** family packages with ocaml_version-ppx patch for compiler compatibility ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
- Introduced multiple **new Jane Street packages** including capsule, capsule0, current_exe, curl_async, portable_lockfree_htbl, heterogeneous_list, ppx_int63_literal, sexp_type, unsafe_clear, and bonsai_term family packages (bonsai_term, bonsai_term_components, bonsai_term_examples, bonsai_term_test) ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
summaries.activity_summary: Three new PRs opened for Dune package management compatibility (ocamlbuild, odoc-parser) and package updates; major version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222
summaries.activity:
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened **Dune package management compatibility** patch for ocamlbuild to address symlink limitation ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21)), referencing upstream work at [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736)
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) opened **odoc-parser Dune compatibility** patch maintaining compatibility with Dune package management ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22)), with related upstream proposal at [ocaml/odoc#1392](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1392)
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) opened PR adding **package updates** for ocamlbuild, async_ssl, alcotest, sedlex, topkg, and uutf to enable compilation of more upstream packages ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/23))
- **Major version bump** across 200+ Jane Street packages from v0.18~preview.130.55+197 to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 including async, bonsai, core, ppx suite, hardcaml family, and many others ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on Dune package management compatibility and maintaining oxcaml-specific patches for ecosystem packages
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Dune package management compatibility** emerging as priority with patches addressing symlink limitations and ensuring packages build with both Dune and opam ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21), [#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22))
- **Oxcaml-specific compatibility work** continuing with patches for ppxlib, eio, js_of_ocaml, and other core packages to maintain compatibility with oxcaml's modal type system extensions ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24))
- **Regular preview releases** with version bump pattern v0.18~preview.130.76+222 indicating active development and testing cycle for Jane Street packages
summaries.contributors_summary: Anil Madhavapeddy merged eio fix and opened package updates PR; Sudha Parimala opened two Dune compatibility patches
summaries.contributors:
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) fixed eio.1.3+ox compatibility with oxcaml by addressing function currying requirements ([#24](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/24)), committed major package version bump to v0.18~preview.130.76+222 ([c66cb66](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/c66cb66c45537f9dccaf20d9fca8360614474487)), and opened PR for package updates including ocamlbuild, async_ssl, alcotest, sedlex, topkg, and uutf ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/23))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) contributed Dune package management compatibility patches for ocamlbuild addressing symlink limitation ([#21](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/21)) and odoc-parser ([#22](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/22)), participated in discussion about Dune incompatibility issues with reference to [ocaml/dune#12736](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12736)

summaries.brief_summary: Package maintenance for js_of_ocaml with patch updates and dependency conflict resolution
summaries.new_features_summary: Updated iarray primitives patch and relaxed dune version constraint
summaries.new_features:
- Updated **iarray primitives patch** for js_of_ocaml to align with upstream changes in runtime code structure, fixing patch application failures ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Removed **ppx_optcomp patch** (`js_of_ocaml-ocaml_version-ppx.patch`) across all js_of_ocaml packages that was causing build failures ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
- Relaxed **dune version constraint** in `ocaml-variants.5.2.0+ox` from exact version `3.20.2+ox` to allow versions greater than `3.20.2` ([159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
summaries.activity_summary: Package maintenance focused on js_of_ocaml patch compatibility
summaries.activity:
- Fixed **patch validation issues** with js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch that was failing with recent opam versions' stricter patch validation logic ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Removed obsolete **ppx_optcomp patches** that were causing build failures after being reintroduced, affecting js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, js_of_ocaml, and wasm_of_ocaml-compiler packages ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
- Updated **package dependency constraints** to relax dune version requirements in ocaml-variants package ([a1ea0d3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/a1ea0d33dd5662b89183f751c3fec566d7860b75), [159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
summaries.discussions_summary: Discussion on patch validation logic differences between opam and GNU patch
summaries.notable_discussions:
- Discussion about **patch validation compatibility** revealed that recent opam versions switched to stricter patch validation logic than GNU patch, leading to the resolution that publishing code now uses the same logic to prevent future errors ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- Investigation into **ppx_optcomp dependency issues** where patches that had previously been removed returned, suggesting potential interactions with other patch sets that may have introduced ppx_optcomp as a dependency ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on patch maintenance and opam compatibility improvements
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Patch compatibility maintenance** becoming more critical as opam adopts stricter validation logic, requiring alignment between patch generation and validation tools ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- **Build infrastructure improvements** to catch patch validation issues earlier in the publishing pipeline ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19))
- **Package constraint relaxation** allowing more flexibility in dependency versions for better compatibility ([159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
summaries.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris implemented patch fixes with review feedback from @dkalinichenko-js
summaries.contributors:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) authored both PRs this week, fixing the js_of_ocaml iarray primitives patch compatibility issue ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19)) and removing the problematic ppx_optcomp patch ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/20)), along with follow-up commits updating opam package constraints ([a1ea0d3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/a1ea0d33dd5662b89183f751c3fec566d7860b75), [159337c](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/159337cc7bf8e58f1cb7db1c2d9e999fcc341d31))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided code review and investigation support on [#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/19), helping identify the root cause of the patch validation issues with opam's stricter logic

summaries.brief_summary: Two new PRs opened addressing js_of_ocaml patches and build issues
summaries.activity_summary: Two PRs opened to fix js_of_ocaml patches and iarray compatibility issues
summaries.activity:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened PR to remove `[%%if]` patch for jsoo toplevel that was breaking builds ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/20)), addressing regression where patches removed in [#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7) had reappeared
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) opened PR to repatch js_of_ocaml iarray handling ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/19)), investigating potential commit mismatch in js_of_ocaml dependency similar to issue [#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11)
summaries.trends_summary: Ongoing maintenance work addressing patch stability issues in js_of_ocaml integration
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Patch stability challenges** with js_of_ocaml integration showing recurring issues where previously resolved patches reappear ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/20), [#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/19)), suggesting need for better dependency pinning or upstream coordination
- Build system maintenance focusing on **compatibility patches** for JavaScript backend tooling, with attention to ppx_optcomp syntax handling and iarray implementations
summaries.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris opened two PRs addressing js_of_ocaml build and patch issues
summaries.contributors: - [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) identified and opened PRs to address js_of_ocaml patch regressions ([#20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/20)) and iarray compatibility issues ([#19](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/19)), investigating root causes related to dependency versioning and patch application

summaries.brief_summary: Release minus-19 with v0.18~preview.130.55+197 packages, new library support (ctypes, dune 3.20.2, lwt, re), and js_of_ocaml patches.
summaries.new_features_summary: Added ctypes, dune 3.20.2, lwt, and re libraries with patches; updated js_of_ocaml with atomics, unboxed indexing, and bug fixes.
summaries.new_features:
- **js_of_ocaml 6.0.1+ox** patches updated with atomic operations support (`js_of_ocaml-atomics.patch`, `js_of_ocaml-atomic-cmpxchg.patch`), comprehensive **unboxed indexing** implementation (`js_of_ocaml-unboxed-indexing.patch` with 1531 lines), **local bytes** support, and fixes for global deadcode analysis and GitHub issue [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034) ([eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f))
- **ctypes 0.23.0+ox** and **ctypes-foreign 0.23.0+ox** added with bigarray compatibility patches for the oxcaml variant ([5384cd12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/5384cd124861e3dcc84786066506e34ba6906f4c))
- **dune 3.20.2+ox**, **dune-rpc 3.20.2+ox**, **dyn 3.20.2+ox**, **ocamlc-loc 3.20.2+ox**, and **ordering 3.20.2+ox** packages introduced with oxcaml-specific patches ([26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **lwt 5.9.2+ox** library added with oxcaml compatibility patches ([26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **re 1.14.0+ox** regular expression library added with extensive portability patches (825 lines), iarray support, and fixes for PCRE split functionality ([26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96))
- **zarith 1.14+ox** merged enabling installation of latest TLS libraries ([#14](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/14))
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml-compiler 6.0.1+ox** patch application errors by updating iarray primitives and floatarray patches ([#12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/12))
summaries.activity_summary: Release minus-19 merged 558 files with v0.18~preview.130.55+197 Jane Street packages including new libraries and compiler tooling.
summaries.activity:
- **Release minus-19** merged by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) updating to v0.18~preview.130.55+197 across the Jane Street ecosystem with 558 changed files, 21,920 additions, and 7,087 deletions ([#18](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/18))
- **New Jane Street packages** added in v0.18~preview.130.55+197 including `big_percent`, `concurrent`, `flexible_sexp`, `insertion_ordered_map`, `nonempty_interval_lib`, `pending_or_error`, `portable_async`, `portable_ws_deque`, and multiple ppx extensions (`ppx_anonymous_record`, `ppx_array`, `ppx_array_base`, `ppx_box`, `ppx_fuelproof`, `ppx_portable`) ([879a5b20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/879a5b204c654db23fde5c0af474aeee51614e21))
- **Core libraries** updated including `core`, `core_bench`, `core_unix`, `async` (with multiple variants: `async_smtp`, `async_kernel`, `async_rpc_kernel`, `async_unix`, `async_js`), `bonsai` (with `bonsai_test`, `bonsai_web`, `bonsai_web_test`, `bonsai_web_components`), `ecaml`, `memtrace_viewer`, `parallel`, and ppx tooling (`ppx_jane`, `ppx_log`, `ppx_quick_test`, `ppx_typed_fields`, `ppx_demo`) ([879a5b20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/879a5b204c654db23fde5c0af474aeee51614e21))
- **Build system** updates with GitHub Actions test workflow modifications and dune version compatibility improvements ([eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f), [96eafdc6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/96eafdc6886ac24f1e28ec6d2b9216680f8246a0))
- **ppxlib and tooling** patches updated including AST builder enhancements, pattern matching improvements, driver functionality updates, and documentation additions for writing ppxs ([eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f))
- **gen_js_api** and **ojs** updated with AST compatibility patches ([eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f))
summaries.trends_summary: Focused expansion of oxcaml package ecosystem with Jane Street v0.18 preview updates and foundational library support.
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Comprehensive Jane Street ecosystem** integration with v0.18~preview.130.55+197 bringing latest experimental features to oxcaml including new utility libraries and ppx extensions
- **Foundational library support** expansion with addition of widely-used OCaml libraries (ctypes, lwt, re, dune 3.20.2) ensuring broader compatibility with existing OCaml codebases
- **js_of_ocaml enhancement** focus on advanced features including atomic operations, unboxed indexing for performance, and local allocation support aligning with OCaml 5.x capabilities
- **Build infrastructure** improvements for CI/CD workflows and package dependency management indicating maturation of the repository
summaries.contributors_summary: [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) merged release minus-19, [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) added zarith support.
summaries.contributors:
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) merged the comprehensive release minus-19 bringing v0.18~preview.130.55+197 Jane Street packages ([#18](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/18)) and committed numerous package updates throughout the week ([879a5b20](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/879a5b204c654db23fde5c0af474aeee51614e21), [ce27fce9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/ce27fce96df0e4497d958e459287bef09ed70394), [2f3065bc](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/2f3065bc5278f087318e55815b4015298f501acd))
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) added zarith 1.14+ox enabling TLS library installation ([#14](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/14)), updated js_of_ocaml patches ([3da83288](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/3da83288a21ed0f18e794e3a8f6ad7430181f777)), added ctypes support ([5384cd12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/5384cd124861e3dcc84786066506e34ba6906f4c)), updated dune and mdx packages ([26cb9899](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/26cb9899ece2c113b2703b1757d02b0b8cb86d96), [2da68b29](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/2da68b299f32c88ddda75d2d883b80049515b3c0)), and improved GitHub Actions workflows ([eeedfd91](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/eeedfd918e54a8741d26af1a4ff2991b21c1045f), [96eafdc6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/96eafdc6886ac24f1e28ec6d2b9216680f8246a0))
- [Gopher](https://github.com/irategopher) reported compilation issues with js_of_ocaml-compiler which were resolved as an opam version problem ([#12](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/12))

summaries.brief_summary: Fixed uutf package Cmdliner 2.0 compatibility and added dev branch CI workflow
summaries.new_features_summary: Package conflict resolution for Cmdliner 2.0 and CI workflow dev branch support
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **uutf.1.0.3+ox** package conflict declaration to mark **Cmdliner 2.0** as incompatible ([#16](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/16))
- Added **dev branch** to CI test workflow triggers enabling continuous testing on development branch ([#17](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/17))
summaries.activity_summary: Package compatibility fixes and CI workflow improvements
summaries.activity:
- Resolved **Cmdliner compatibility** issue by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) updating uutf package conflict declaration to exclude Cmdliner >= 2.0.0, porting changes from [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([#16](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/16))
- Enhanced **CI workflow** by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) adding dev branch to GitHub Actions test triggers for continuous testing on development work ([#17](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/17))

summaries.brief_summary: Package updates for ppx_deriving with oxidized patches and opam compatibility issues reported
summaries.new_features_summary: Added oxidized ppx_deriving 6.1.1+ox package with compatibility patches for oxcaml parsetree changes
summaries.new_features: - Added **oxidized ppx_deriving** package version 6.1.1+ox with compatibility patches for oxcaml parsetree changes while maintaining original functionality ([#13](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/13))

summaries.brief_summary: Issue reported for js_of_ocaml-compiler compilation failure with patch application errors

summaries.brief_summary: Fixed js_of_ocaml patch compatibility issue across multiple packages
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed js_of_ocaml installation failures by updating patch files for iarray primitives
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml installation failures** by correcting patch file line numbers for iarray primitives across five packages ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- Updated **patch compatibility** for js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, js_of_ocaml, and wasm_of_ocaml-compiler packages to align with current source code structure ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.activity_summary: Single bug fix merged addressing patch application failures in js_of_ocaml ecosystem
summaries.activity:
- **js_of_ocaml patch fixes** merged by [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) resolving installation failures on macOS with opam 2.4.1 ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- **Patch compatibility discussion** emerged regarding differences between GNU Patch and hannesm/patch behavior, with investigation needed for proper upstream fix ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
summaries.contributors_summary: Matthew Else fixed js_of_ocaml patch issues with community feedback from avsm and kit-ty-kate
summaries.contributors:
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) implemented patch fixes for js_of_ocaml installation failures, updating patch line numbers across five packages ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- [@avsm](https://github.com/avsm) reported the macOS installation breakage and provided detailed error diagnostics for the patch application failure ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- [@kit-ty-kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided technical guidance on patch behavior differences and suggested opening upstream tickets for proper resolution ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))

summaries.brief_summary: Major package updates delivered including js_of_ocaml toplevel support, eio integration, and documentation tools
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed js_of_ocaml iarray primitives, enabled toplevel support, and added comprehensive eio package support
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml iarray primitives** patches across all js_of_ocaml packages, addressing runtime issues with array operations ([053992d](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/053992dc2d2889424a95c30d6ee575b38a1244da))
- **Toplevel support** for js_of_ocaml enabled with comprehensive patches for interactive OCaml usage in browser environments ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **Eio package integration** with patched versions of eio, eio_linux, eio_main, and eio_posix for concurrent I/O operations ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Documentation toolchain** updates including odoc packages (odoc, odoc-driver, odoc-md, odoc-parser) and sherlodoc for enhanced documentation generation ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Utop upgrade** to version 2.16.0 with updated patches for improved REPL experience ([#10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/10))
- **MDX package** updated with unit-info patches for literate programming support ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
summaries.activity_summary: One new PR opened for js_of_ocaml patches alongside completion of major package integration work
summaries.activity:
- **New PR opened** by [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) fixing js_of_ocaml patch issues that were preventing successful installation ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))
- **Documentation infrastructure** completed by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) with comprehensive odoc toolchain integration including all related packages and eio support for odoc driver functionality ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Development tools** enhanced through utop 2.16.0 upgrade ([#10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/10)) and mdx literate programming updates ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
- **JavaScript compilation** improvements delivered with toplevel support and unified patches across js_of_ocaml package family ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on modernizing JavaScript compilation and documentation tooling infrastructure
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **JavaScript tooling modernization** with comprehensive js_of_ocaml package updates emphasizing browser-based OCaml development and interactive toplevel support
- **Documentation infrastructure** investment through complete odoc toolchain integration, preparing for enhanced documentation generation capabilities
- **Concurrent I/O** preparation with eio package integration, enabling modern asynchronous programming patterns in OCaml
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam delivered major infrastructure work while Matthew Else addressed critical installation issues
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) implemented comprehensive package integrations including the complete odoc documentation toolchain with eio support ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)), upgraded utop to version 2.16.0 ([#10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/10)), updated mdx with newer Oxcaml compatibility ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), and enabled js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality with unified patches ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- [Matthew Else](https://github.com/matthewelse) identified and opened a fix for js_of_ocaml installation failures caused by bad patches, enabling successful compilation ([#11](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/11))

summaries.brief_summary: Added patched eio and odoc ecosystem packages for Oxcaml compatibility
summaries.new_features_summary: Added patched eio packages and complete odoc ecosystem with Oxcaml-specific patches
summaries.new_features:
- **eio ecosystem packages** added with Oxcaml-specific patches including eio, eio_linux, eio_main, and eio_posix for enhanced async I/O support ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Complete odoc documentation suite** integrated including odoc, odoc-driver, odoc-parser, odoc-md, and sherlodoc packages from oxcaml organization ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **ocaml-lsp-server compatibility patch** added to work with latest odoc-parser version for improved editor support ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **mdx package updates** with new unit-info patch and migration to git+https source URLs for better maintainability ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9))
summaries.activity_summary: Two new PRs opened for package ecosystem integration with extensive collaboration on source URL management
summaries.activity:
- **Two new PRs opened** during the week by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam): odoc and eio integration ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)) and mdx patch updates ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), both merged in early September
- **Package source strategy discussion** between [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) regarding git+https URLs versus patch files for easier maintenance ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8))
- **Comprehensive package integration** work involving 15+ opam files added for the complete odoc documentation toolchain and eio async I/O library ecosystem
summaries.discussions_summary: Collaborative discussion on package maintenance strategy between direct git sources and patch files
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Package maintenance strategy debate** in [#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8) where [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) advocated for direct git+https URLs over patch files for easier maintenance, leading [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) to migrate from patch-based to direct repository sourcing approach
- **Source URL management discussion** highlighting the trade-offs between pointing to upstream repositories with patches versus maintaining forks within the oxcaml organization for a fast-moving ecosystem
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam led package integration work with collaborative input from avsm on maintenance strategy
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) authored both PRs during the week, implementing comprehensive integration of eio async I/O packages ([#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8)) and mdx documentation tool updates ([#9](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/9)), along with multiple commits transitioning from patch-based to git+https source management
- [@avsm](https://github.com/avsm) provided technical guidance on package maintenance strategies in [#8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/8), advocating for direct git repository sources over patch files for the fast-moving oxcaml ecosystem

summaries.brief_summary: js_of_ocaml toplevel support added with unified patches and new PR opened for future integration
summaries.new_features_summary: js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality enabled with comprehensive patches across all related packages
summaries.new_features:
- **js_of_ocaml toplevel support** enabled through comprehensive patches by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris), implementing interactive OCaml toplevel in the browser ([97c0750](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/97c0750314578ee8d74564611ccdae4f3ac06047))
- **Unified patch system** across all js_of_ocaml packages, eliminating inconsistencies between js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, and js_of_ocaml packages ([523918939](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/523918939a359934505ef66c2eae622676e9b0ab))
- **Removed obsolete patches** including js_of_ocaml-ocaml_version-ppx.patch that was no longer needed ([7aefc10](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/7aefc10c3c3f7f27b6cf89f9af1c6a57e1a844f8))
summaries.activity_summary: Single PR opened for js_of_ocaml toplevel integration with significant implementation work completed
summaries.activity:
- **New PR opened** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) to enable js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality, incorporating patches from [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) with unified approach across all js_of_ocaml packages ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- **Implementation completed** during the week with 1,165 lines added and 116 lines deleted across 23 files, covering js_of_ocaml-compiler, js_of_ocaml-ppx, js_of_ocaml-toplevel, and js_of_ocaml packages ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
summaries.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam authored comprehensive js_of_ocaml toplevel implementation with patches from Patrick Ferris
summaries.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) authored the comprehensive implementation of js_of_ocaml toplevel support, unifying patches across all related packages and opening PR for integration ([#7](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/7))
- [@patricoferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) provided the original patches for js_of_ocaml toplevel functionality that enable interactive OCaml sessions in web browsers

summaries.brief_summary: Package maintenance week with ocaml_simd fixes and compiler tag updates by Max Slater
summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed dune sandboxing issue in ppxlib_ast and updated ocaml_simd to installable version
summaries.new_features:
- Fixed **dune sandboxing compatibility** in ppxlib_ast by removing problematic `set -euo pipefail` from cleanup script, resolving WSL/Ubuntu build issues ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
- Updated **ocaml_simd package** to installable version v0.18~preview.130.36+326 with corrected archive source ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
- Updated **ocaml-variants compiler** to use tagged release 5.2.0minus-11-opam instead of commit hash for better version management ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
summaries.activity_summary: Single maintenance PR merged fixing package installation and build issues
summaries.activity: - **Package maintenance** completed by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) addressing ocaml_simd installation problems and build script compatibility issues ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))
summaries.contributors_summary: Max Slater contributed package fixes and maintenance updates
summaries.contributors: - [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) implemented fixes for ocaml_simd package installation issues, updated compiler tag references, and resolved dune sandboxing problems affecting WSL/Ubuntu environments ([#6](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/6))

summaries.brief_summary: Extended testing infrastructure to support more Linux distributions and arm64 architecture with dependency fixes
summaries.new_features_summary: GitHub Actions workflow expanded to test on Archlinux, Debian, Ubuntu containers and arm64 architecture
summaries.new_features:
- **Expanded CI testing** with support for **Archlinux**, **Debian**, and **Ubuntu** containers across x86_64 and arm64 architectures ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Extracted reusable action** `test-oxcaml` for consistent OCaml setup with predefined opam packages across different environments ([0f21e33](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/0f21e338e024671663c4e4d60a11adde7ed5ed98))
- **Added conf-which dependency** to support Archlinux and other distributions requiring which command for builds ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
- **Disabled opam sandboxing** when running in Docker containers to prevent permission conflicts ([19ab0e8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/19ab0e89688859f77f596534e8eb33f833029296))
summaries.activity_summary: Two PRs merged focusing on CI infrastructure improvements and build dependency management
summaries.activity:
- **CI infrastructure improvements** completed by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) with testing expansion to multiple Linux distributions and arm64 support ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5))
- **Build dependency fixes** merged to ensure compatibility with Archlinux by adding conf-which and marking conf-autoconf as build dependencies ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4))
- **GitHub Actions workflow refactoring** with extraction of reusable action and separation of Linux container testing from macOS testing for better organization
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on improving cross-platform compatibility and testing infrastructure robustness
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform testing expansion** with emphasis on supporting diverse Linux distributions beyond Ubuntu
- **Container-based CI** adoption to ensure consistent testing environments across different architectures
- **Modular GitHub Actions** development with reusable components for OCaml project setup
summaries.contributors_summary: Puneeth Chaganti contributed CI improvements and dependency fixes with review support from dkalinichenko-js
summaries.contributors:
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) implemented testing expansion across Linux distributions and arm64 architecture ([#5](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/5)), added build dependency fixes for Archlinux compatibility ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/4)), and created reusable GitHub Actions for OCaml setup
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided review feedback and approval for both infrastructure improvements, ensuring quality of the CI enhancements

summaries.brief_summary: Package dependency improvements and CI infrastructure establishment for oxcaml variant distribution
summaries.new_features_summary: Added build dependencies and updated source URLs for improved platform compatibility
summaries.new_features:
- Added **conf-which** as build dependency for improved compatibility with ArchLinux and other distributions [#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/4)
- Marked **conf-autoconf** as build dependency for cleaner dependency management [#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/4)
- Updated **source URL** to specific commit reference for more stable package builds [50ae6c8](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/50ae6c8d27ebd591289d599995008124b554b829)
summaries.activity_summary: Established comprehensive CI infrastructure and resolved build compatibility issues across multiple platforms
summaries.activity:
- **Continuous integration** setup by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) with GitHub Actions testing OCaml variant 5.2.0+ox across Ubuntu x64/arm64 and macOS Intel/arm64 platforms ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/3))
- **Build script compatibility** fix for ppxlib_ast cleanup script to use bash explicitly, resolving build failures ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/1))
- **Package testing** expanded with additional packages verified through CI infrastructure as confirmed by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/3))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on establishing robust CI infrastructure and improving cross-platform compatibility
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform compatibility** emphasis with attention to distribution-specific requirements like ArchLinux dependencies
- **Automated testing** infrastructure establishment with comprehensive platform coverage including both x64 and ARM64 architectures
- **Build reliability** improvements through explicit dependency management and script compatibility fixes
summaries.contributors_summary: Single contributor driving repository establishment with infrastructure setup and dependency management
summaries.contributors:
- [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) established the repository infrastructure by implementing GitHub Actions CI ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/3)), adding platform-specific build dependencies ([#4](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/4)), and fixing build script compatibility issues ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/1))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided feedback on package testing additions in the CI setup ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/3))

summaries.brief_summary: Added CI workflow, fixed build issues, and completed package rebranding from Jane Street to OxCaml
summaries.new_features_summary: GitHub Actions CI workflow for multi-platform testing and ppxlib_ast build script fixes
summaries.new_features:
- **GitHub Actions CI workflow** added for testing package installation across multiple platforms including Ubuntu (x64, ARM64) and macOS (Intel, ARM64) with OxCaml compiler variant [#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3)
- **ppxlib_ast build script fix** to use bash instead of sh, resolving build failures [#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1), [#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2)
- **Documentation improvements** with updated README featuring OxCaml branding, improved installation instructions, and comprehensive platform compatibility information [8a89fa2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/commit/8a89fa2def133816c885b75c1021f6e4218d25b8)
summaries.activity_summary: Three PRs merged focusing on CI infrastructure and build fixes by Puneeth Chaganti
summaries.activity:
- **CI infrastructure** established with [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) adding GitHub Actions workflow for automated testing across Ubuntu and macOS platforms ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3))
- **Build system fixes** delivered through two consecutive PRs fixing ppxlib_ast cleanup script execution by [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1), [#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2))
- **Package ecosystem update** involving hundreds of package variants renamed from `+jst` to `+ox` suffix, completing the transition from Jane Street to OxCaml branding across the entire repository
- **Documentation overhaul** transforming README from Jane Street to OxCaml branding with enhanced installation instructions and platform compatibility details
summaries.trends_summary: Repository transition from Jane Street to OxCaml branding and focus on CI automation
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Branding transition** from Jane Street to OxCaml with systematic package renaming across hundreds of packages using `+ox` suffix instead of `+jst`
- **CI automation emphasis** with implementation of comprehensive multi-platform testing infrastructure covering Ubuntu and macOS architectures
- **Build reliability improvements** through shell script compatibility fixes ensuring consistent builds across different environments
summaries.contributors_summary: Puneeth Chaganti from Tarides contributed all three merged PRs for CI and build fixes
summaries.contributors: - [Puneeth Chaganti](https://github.com/punchagan) from Tarides authored all week's activity including the GitHub Actions CI workflow implementation ([#3](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/3)), ppxlib_ast build script fixes ([#1](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/1), [#2](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/issues/2)), and extensive documentation and package rebranding work across the repository
